newsitem.title: USA: North Sea Brent paper crude steady late in U.S.
newsitem.headline: North Sea Brent paper crude steady late in U.S.

text.p: Traders eager to start the long U.S. Memorial Day holiday weekend abandoned North Sea Brent markets for roads out of town Friday.
Foreign dealers said all they could find in the way of trades were two Brent inter-month deals at steady prices.
A paper Brent cargo was dealt for June/July at plus six cents, and a second cargo was moved at plus 6.5 cents. A major European oil refiner bought both parcels, traders said.
July IPE Brent settled at $20.00, 18 cents lower.
